tracks.title: I Will Protect
tracks.voice_instruct: A raw, emotionally intense male baritone erupting from darkness into blazing defiance, the voice of a man finally speaking the words he was born to speak, triumphant and breaking with emotion
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, explosive anthem building from silence to full orchestral rock, full Honor's Theme hymn-like major key melody on choir unison oath motif, triumphant rising chromatic stormwall motif on ascending strings, soaring male vocals, full band with orchestra, concept album continuity, theatrical, the Second Ideal spoken at last
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The storm inside me breaks, and I am clear,
For the first time in forever, I am here,
The words are rising, burning in my chest,
A promise I've been running from, a test.

[verse 2]
Syl blazes into light, a spear of blue,
She shouts, "The words, Kaladin! Speak them true!"
And everything I am, and everything I've been,
Pours into four words that burn beneath my skin.

[chorus]
I will protect those who cannot protect themselves,
The Second Ideal, ringing clear as bells,
Honor's Theme erupts, a hymn of war and grace,
And Stormlight floods through every broken place.

[bridge]
The stormwall rises, but it's mine to ride,
No longer beaten, no longer terrified,
The wind obeys, the sky is mine to claim,
And Bridge Four follows, calling out my name.

[verse 3]
Rock and Teft and Sigzil, Skar and Drehy too,
Lopen laughing, "Gancho, look what you can do!"
We are the bridgemen, we are the unwanted dead,
And now we fly on storms of blue and red.

[outro]
I will protect, these words are accepted,
The Windrunner rises, broken and perfected.

tracks.title: Bridge Four
tracks.voice_instruct: A raw, emotionally intense male baritone leading a chorus of rough male voices in military-anthem style, the sound of brothers-in-arms, joyful and fierce
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, triumphant military rock anthem with rising chromatic stormwall motif charging forward, Honor's Theme hymn-like melody as marching song with choir, driving drums and brass, anthemic male group vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, Bridge Four's transformation anthem
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
We carried death upon our backs for miles,
Through arrow fire and highprinces' smiles,
They used us, burned us, never learned our names,
But we are still here, we outlived their games.

[verse 2]
Now Teft glows, and Rock can see the spren,
And Sigzil calculates our strength again,
We train with spears, we train with light and wind,
A crew of broken men who will not bend.

[chorus]
Bridge Four! Bridge Four! The cry that shakes the Plains,
We are the storm that breaks the master's chains,
From slaves to soldiers, from the damned to free,
Bridge Four forever, this is what we'll be.

[bridge]
The stormwall charges with us, not against,
The wind that broke us now becomes our fence,
And Honor's melody is our marching song,
The bridge crew rises, forty thousand strong
In spirit, if not numbers, heart, and will,
Bridge Four, Bridge Four, unconquerable still.

[verse 3]
Moash has questions, doubts behind his eyes,
About the lighteyes, about their pretty lies,
But I say, "Trust me, brother, trust the Four,"
And he salutes, though something in him's sore.

[outro]
Bridge Four lifts the bridge, and the bridge lifts us,
From the ashes of the chasm, from the dust.

tracks.title: The Bondsmith's Burden
tracks.voice_instruct: A deep, commanding male bass-baritone finding spiritual weight, the voice of a man accepting an impossible calling, grave and resolute
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, weighty prog rock with Honor's Theme hymn-like melody in minor key on clean guitar arpeggio over organ, fading distorted industrial Thrill riff being rejected, heavy bass and sustained organ chords, dramatic male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, Bondsmith bonding scene
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The Stormfather speaks, his voice like rolling tide,
"You are unworthy, Blackthorn, full of pride,
But Honor chose you, and I must obey,
Bond with me, and walk a narrow way."

[verse 2]
I feel the bond like chains of living light,
The weight of every storm, of every night,
A Bondsmith holds the world together, seamed,
And I'm the broken man who dared to dream.

[chorus]
The Bondsmith's burden, heavier than stone,
To unite a world that wants to stand alone,
I feel the Thrill still calling in my blood,
But I reject it, I reject the flood.

[bridge]
Honor's melody in minor key, I hear
The version meant for men who live in fear
Of what they've done, of what they might become,
The echo says, "Dalinar, you're not done."

[verse 3]
The Thrill retreats, a riff that fades to hum,
I will not be the Blackthorn, will not succumb,
"I am the man I choose to be today,"
And the Stormfather rumbles, "Very well, then. Stay."

[outro]
The Bondsmith walks, the burden on his back,
Holding the world together, seam and crack.

tracks.title: The Everstorm
tracks.voice_instruct: A deep, commanding male bass-baritone confronting apocalypse, urgent and desperate but holding firm, the voice of a leader who sees doom and refuses to flinch
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, apocalyptic prog metal with inverted stormwall motif from the wrong direction on reversed orchestral strings, distorted industrial Thrill riff erupting everywhere, massive orchestral chaos, urgent male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, the Desolation begins
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The storm comes from the west, and that's all wrong,
A thousand years of highstorms, and the song
Has always moved from east to west, but now
The sky inverts, the world forgets its vow.

[verse 2]
The Parshmen glow with light that is not right,
Red lightning where there should be amber bright,
They rise, ten million servants, in an hour,
Transformed to Fused, consumed by ancient power.

[chorus]
The Everstorm, the Everstorm has come,
The Desolation wakes, the world goes numb,
A stormwall rising from the wrongest side,
And nothing we have built can stem this tide.

[bridge]
The Thrill erupts in soldiers on the Plains,
In Dalinar, the old familiar chains,
But this time, this time, the Blackthorn holds the line,
"This is not honor, this is not mine."

[verse 3]
The Fused descend with powers long forgot,
Voidlight in their eyes, their vengeance hot,
And Roshar, peaceful, shattered, unaware,
Must face the war that's always been right there.

[outro]
The Everstorm circles, never going home,
And Dalinar stands at the eye, alone.

tracks.title: The Diagram
tracks.voice_instruct: A haunted, controlled male tenor with Middle Eastern inflections, discovering the machinery behind his purpose, voice shifting between cold clarity and existential horror
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, calculating industrial rock with mechanical distorted Thrill riff as calculation motif, corrupted Honor's Theme on detuned piano, mathematical rhythmic patterns, concept album continuity, theatrical, the Diagram revealed
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
A wall of scribbled genius, edge to edge,
Equations, names, and futures on a ledge,
Taravangian wrote it in a single night,
When Cultivation made him burning bright.

[verse 2]
One day a genius, next day barely there,
He weeps for those he's killed, he tears his hair,
But the Diagram demands, the numbers say
That some must die so others get to stay.

[chorus]
The Diagram, the Diagram, the plan,
To save the world by breaking every man
Who stands between the calculus and hope,
A genius, a tyrant, and a rope.

[bridge]
The Thrill of calculation, cold as steel,
A heartbeat made of numbers, what they feel
Is nothing, they are variables and dust,
And I, Szeth, am the function of their trust.

[verse 3]
He says, "Forgive me," as he signs the list,
Another king to fall beneath my fist,
The Diagram corrupts what honor means,
And I obey, a weapon in between.

[outro]
The Diagram unfolds, the numbers grow,
And Szeth wonders what the truthless truly know.

tracks.title: Skybreaker
tracks.voice_instruct: A haunted, controlled male tenor reaching for something beyond his grasp, tentative hope cracking through layers of shame, Middle Eastern inflections with a searching quality
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, searching prog rock with tentative Honor's Theme hymn-like melody that Szeth reaches for but cannot fully grasp on distant clean guitar, legal and judicial percussion patterns, restrained male vocals building to desperate plea, concept album continuity, theatrical, Skybreaker recruitment
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
I've killed a hundred men for masters' gain,
Each death a stone that adds onto the chain,
But now Nale stands before me, Herald, judge,
And says, "The law, not masters, will not budge."

[verse 2]
The Skybreakers follow codes of ancient writ,
Not honor's wavering flame, but justice lit
By statute, by the letter, by the book,
A different chain, but still, the world's a hook.

[chorus]
Skybreaker, Skybreaker, show me the way,
Between the truthless night and honor's day,
I've followed orders all my broken life,
Now show me law that's sharper than a knife.

[bridge]
A hymn, half-heard, the honor melody,
I reach for it, but it's too far from me,
I've killed too many, stained my hands too deep,
But maybe law can teach a stone to weep.

[verse 3]
Nale says, "Choose your truth, your highest lord,
A person or a principle, a sword
That serves not kings but justice, cold and fair,"
And Szeth kneels in the cold and broken air.

[outro]
The Skybreaker rises, Truthless no more,
But the truthless wounds still fester at the core.

tracks.title: Shardbearer
tracks.voice_instruct: A bright, youthful male tenor in full warrior mode, the swagger replaced by genuine conviction, fighting for something beyond himself
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, epic battle rock with rising chromatic stormwall motif in battle orchestra, resisted distorted industrial Thrill riff, driving battle drums and orchestral brass, powerful male vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, Battle of Narak
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The Shattered Plains erupt in war tonight,
A thousand soldiers marching toward the fight,
My Plate is cracked, my Blade is in my hand,
The prince of Alethkar makes his final stand.

[verse 2]
They send the Parshendi, singing as they come,
Their rhythms strange, their war a different drum,
I cut through ranks, I do what I was trained,
But every face I see is someone's unnamed.

[chorus]
Shardbearer, Shardbearer, prince and blade,
Is this the man my father's honor made?
I swing, I cut, the bodies fall like rain,
And the Thrill says, "More, more, do it again."

[bridge]
But I say, "No," the way my father taught,
The Thrill is not the victory I sought,
I fight because I must, not for the rush,
And the stormwall parts, and there is only hush.

[verse 3]
Renarin is somewhere in the lines behind,
My brother, fragile, with a brilliant mind,
I fight for him, I fight for father's dream,
That war can serve a purpose, not a scream.

[outro]
The Shardbearer kneels when the battle's done,
And wonders if the war was truly won.

tracks.title: The Perpendicularity
tracks.voice_instruct: A commanding, precise female mezzo-soprano emerging from isolation with renewed steel, the voice of someone forged by solitude, triumphant but changed
tracks.prompt: progressive rock opera, cinematic, transcendent prog rock with stormwall motif as realm-crossing on shimmering orchestral strings, Honor's Theme as Jasnah's resolve on full cello and strings, blinding light sound design, powerful female vocals, concept album continuity, theatrical, return from Shadesmar
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The perpendicularity, a column of raw light,
Where the realms converge, where Shadesmar meets the night,
I step through, and the world crashes back,
Sunlight, air, the physical world's intact.

[verse 2]
I've walked the cognitive realm for weeks alone,
I've bartered with the spren, I've made my throne
Of knowledge, dark and burning, what I've learned
Would make a lesser scholar crash and turn.

[chorus]
I'm back, and I am not the same,
Jasnah Kholin, but a different flame,
Shadesmar forged me, hammered out the doubt,
The perpendicularity let me out.

[bridge]
Honor's theme is mine now, cold and clear,
A scholar's resolution, void of fear,
The stormwall between worlds, I've walked it through,
And now I know exactly what to do.

[verse 3]
The Desolation's coming, Voidbringers rise,
And I carry answers that will crystallize
The war ahead, the alliances we need,
But first, I have a student's wounds to read.

[outro]
The perpendicularity closes behind,
And Jasnah returns with fire in her mind.
